rationale: The estimated extent of occurrence and area of occupancy are less than 10,000 km² and 2,000 km², respectively. It is only known from five locations from Liberia. The extent and quality of habitat is undergoing and continuous decline due to urbanisation, mining, agriculture and deforestation developments.The species is therefore assessed as Vulnerable B1ab(iii)+2ab(iii). As it is only known from only five locations which are under threats from habitat degradation it also qualifies as Vulnerable D2.
evaluator: Entsua-Mensah, M., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.
